result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Prosecuting attorney Brandon Ruffalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Colton D Van Veghel in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Colton D Van Veghel.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 06:00 pm.

940.19(2) - Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm
947.01(1) - Disorderly Conduct
Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants and Defendant shall not be on the premises of any bar or tavern or any establishment which has a primary purpose of serving alcohol. 
Defendant shall have no contact with the following named person(s) or their residence(s): A.E.B. (dob 08-01-1973) and Slip Inn
Defendant shall immediately provide a DNA sample, pursuant to Wis.Stat.165.76(1)(gm), based on your arrest for a "violent crime" as defined in 165.84(7)(ab). As required in 970.0(8), you are hereby notified that you may request expungement of a specimen pursuant to 165.77(4).
Judge's response to request to adjourn 7-18-22 initial appearance - Denied. No reason was given for the requested adjournment.
